titleStmt.title: The araignment of leuud, idle, froward, and vnconstant women or the vanitie of them, choose you whether : with a commendation of wise, vertuous and honest women : pleasant for married men, profitable for young men, and hurtfull to none.
Arraignment of lewd, idle, froward, and unconstant women. 1615
titleStmt.author: Swetnam, Joseph, fl. 1617.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by George Purslowe for Thomas Archer, and are to be solde at his shop in Popes-head Pallace, neere the Royall Exchange,

notesStmt.note: Errors in paging: p. 20-21 reversed in the numbering.
Imperfect: tightly bound, with slight loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop in Popes-head Pallace, neere the Royall Exchange
